location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.262 of 1856 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, relating to reports by the Native Agent at Muscat of the ill-treatment of owners of vessels flying the British flag at Muscat. The first enclosure is a copy of letter no.32 of 1856 (folio 147) from the Persian Department, containing the substance of a letter from Heskiel bin Yousoof, the Native Agent at Muscat, to the Persian Secretary to Government, dated 8 January 1856, requesting clarification as to whether the vessel owners are considered British subjects. The second enclosure is a copy of a Resolution by the Board (folio 148), dated 22 January 1856, confirming that the owners of vessel flying British colours at Muscat can be considered British subjects.
